result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus P. Stage

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the cases. Requests another status with a possible plea and sentencing.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:47 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

The original document was titled: Victim Impact Statement
The original history event date is: 07-20-2022
Order to Seal VIS - Stage, Marcus P.

11:50 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF99 and 22CM21 called 

Atty Key is heard. 

22CF99 - Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Key is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will plea not guilty as to each count, clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

22CM21 to be scheduled for a JSH.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's CORRECTED Waiver of Preliminary Hearing
Notice of Retainer - Attorney Daniel M. Key

Adjustment Number: 22A 001711,
Payable Number: 71120,
Receipt Number: 22R 001898,
Amount: $20.00

9:16 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CM21 and 22CF99 called together

22CF99 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
22CM21 - Adjourn to track along with defendants other case. 
Atty Key is heard and requests that both cases are continued to another date.
22CF99 - Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:45 am.
22CM21 - JSH hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by video in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with SJG.

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with SJG.

Court advises right to an attorney. 


.
Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with SJG.
